title: Selendang (shoulder Cloth), 19th century
medium:
Medium: silk
Technique: tied resist, stitched resist (tritik), and printed with metallic pigments(prada)
description: Red and green rectangular panel of silk. White rectangular border around the green separates it from the surrounding red. The gold printing (prada technique) makes use of the "tumpal" motif (row of isosceles triangles) and other geometric and floral shapes.

tombstone.epitaph:
Selendang (shoulder Cloth), 19th century.Medium: silk
Technique: tied resist, stitched resist (tritik), and printed with metallic pigments(prada). 1961-115-10.
